title: Compyx: a free multicolor font — where to publish?
content:
Hi there,

A while ago I created [Compyx](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414234145/http:/pixelambacht.nl/2014/compyx-a-multicolor-8bit-font/), a multicolor font (using Abdobe/Mozilla's SVG-in-OpenType technique). It'll show up like your average singlecolor font in browser that don't support this yet, but it'll show up in classic green/gray colors in Firefox, and soon Chrome.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414234145im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Bpj6a02CMAAC85k_4593.png)

You can download the TTF/WOFF [in the blog post](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414234145/http:/pixelambacht.nl/2014/compyx-a-multicolor-8bit-font/).

I was wondering if you know a good place to upload this font so it can be used by more people. It's pretty much open source/public domain.
author: Pixelambacht

comments.content:
My favourite spots for libre fonts are:  
 [http://www.dafont.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414234145/http:/www.dafont.com/)  
 [http://www.fontsquirrel.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414234145/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/)  
 [http://openfontlibrary.org/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414234145/http:/openfontlibrary.org/)
Thansk! Signing up for Openfontlibrary is impossible from Chrome, the captcha is invisible... But signing up through Firefox works.
I just release the font on [github](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414234145/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fgithub.com/RoelN/Compyx) under the SIL Open Font License, for those interested!
